Comments_List: Michael Farina is such a great professor for this introductory course: if you do the work youll obtain a wide vocabulary and your conversational skills will be very good for only one semester of studying.
I learned grammatical structures that comprise the Italian language, as well as essential vocabulary of introductory Italian.
Learning simple Italian grammar structure and verb conjugation, as well as basic vocabulary words.
I enjoyed the course overall, but I did not like the format of the tests. I would have liked a greater emphasis on grammar than on vocabulary.
I loved this course, this has been my favorite class at Yale so far.

I would absolutely recommend this course, especially with Michael Farina because he made the semester so beneficial in terms of learning the language and making it extremely enjoyable at the same time.
I would recommend this course to another student. I feel like I learned a great deal of Italian in only one semester.
Yes. This course did a great job giving me a baseline understanding of Italian.
